result.execSummary:
The defendant Karen B Rivenbark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Karen B Rivenbark is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Karen B Rivenbark was found guilty of Possession of synthetic cannabinoid, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(em).
  • Karen B Rivenbark was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)

miscConds.notes: Pay $450 fine plus costs on Count 1, costs only on Count 2. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant is required to attend the Victim Impact Panel scheduled for 6/9/16. Submit DNA sample.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: 10 days of sentence are stayed. If Defendant attends the Victim Impact Panel scheduled for 6/9/16, stay will be permanent. If Defendant fails to attend, stay will be lifted. Huber privileges granted. 60 days to report.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karen B Rivenbark

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for 1 year to pay Court-ordered financial obligations

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Karen B Rivenbark in court with attorney Timothy G. Duffy. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss Count 1, presents argument. Court grants motion, reviews charges, max. penalties, elements of remaining charges. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 2, 3. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 2, 3. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Karen B Rivenbark in court with attorney Timothy G. Duffy. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises of contact with crime lab, advises of options provided today to Atty Duffy (wait for private lab results or accept offer crafted by State). Defense requests that case be rescheduled for a few weeks, Defendant needs time to consider offer.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant Karen B Rivenbark in court. Attorney Timothy G. Duffy appeared by phone. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges. Defense enters not guilty pleas. Bond continues as is. State questions motion for judgment on bond forfeiture. Court will not forfeit bond at this time. Defendant questions March 7 date from original OWI citation, is advised she does not have to appear that date.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
Certified mail to Jennifer White - Unclaimed
(in addition to $500 already posted). Conditions remain the same.

Defendant Karen B Rivenbark appeared by video conference. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, issuance of warrant. Court questions Defendant on non-appearance. Defendant was at work, thought Court was March 7. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel. Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
Defendant Karen B Rivenbark not in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, orders bench warrant. State requests warrant.

Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant Karen B Rivenbark appeared by video conference. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 1/25/16, 10:00.
